entry.title: Poozeum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Poozeum holds fossilized dinosaur feces (pictured) which may have come from a T. rex?

entry.title: Suleiman of Germiyan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Suleiman of Germiyan allowed the Ottoman annexation of much of his territory to pay his daughter's dowry?

entry.title: smuggled into Downing Street on 11 December 2020 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a £142 wine fridge was smuggled into Downing Street on 11 December 2020, during the height of the COVID-19 lockdown in the United Kingdom?

entry.title: Verna Osborne (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that voice teacher Verna Osborne retired at the age of 101?

entry.title: used the equivalent energy footprint (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that researchers estimated that training the model for ChatGPT used the equivalent energy footprint of "driving 123 gasoline-powered passenger vehicles for a year"?

entry.title: Felix Eberty (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Felix Eberty was called "an original and ingenious person" by Albert Einstein?

entry.title: H. Wortman Pumping Station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the H. Wortman Pumping Station has four pumps, but is only used in exceptional circumstances?

entry.title: Isaac Coe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that frontier physician Isaac Coe is credited with saving Indianapolis from an 1821 outbreak of malaria?

entry.title: a dating simulator (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an art collective released a dating simulator dedicated to preparing the player's income taxes?
